description:
Found this casual but delicious restaurant with my family when my dad started talking to the owner. We learned that after a fire in the restaurant next door a few months prior, business never quite picked back up. While the wait times at other restaurants on the streets of "Little Italy" were up to 2 hours, we were kindly invited in and seated right away. 
There is a cool, warm vibe with bits of authentic Italian sprinkled throughout the decor, including the great Michelangelo wall statue on the wall. 
We were quickly brought Italian bread and YUM kalamata olives in garlic olive oil...heaven! We ordered caprese salad, good but as expected; spaghetti bolongese--the kind you crave; chicken milanese with nice flavor; chicken parmigian; and topped with complimentary amaretto cookies and gummy bears!
author: Kat R.

description:
Two words. Homemade pasta!!!!
Omg! We tried the papperadelle w/ duck sugo, the shrimp/lobster ravioli, and the gnocchi w/ pesto. 
All of them were perfectly al dente, almost w/ a snap, but 
 chewy /tender.... so delicious. 
The owner/chef came by to visit our table. 
Such a warm, fun place!
I loved the decor, it reminded me of a restaurant where I ate, in Florence.
author: michele s.

description:
Horrible food and rude staff..
They served cold bread and when we asked for warm bread they didn't even acknowledge that there was something wrong with their food. 

Then they got a whole burnt Pizza followed by screwed up Fettucine Alfredo. 
We were horrified that an Italian restaurant can  screw Pizza and Pasta. Very disappointed 
With whole service experience 

Only good thing about this restaurant was there ambience
author: Shivendra K.

description:
If a restaurant can be exactly average, meaning not good enough to talk about afterwards, nor bad enough to feel you've wasted your taste buds in chewing bad food, this would come very close. I used to live in The City, but came back months ago to play tourist. We spent some time around the Pier and North Beach and ended up here for a late lunch. 

Walking in, I enjoyed the decor. Carvings and artwork gave this place an old school Italian eatery vibe. A large bowl of what I hopoed to be freshly grated Parmesan cheese sat on an empty table. I also hoped no bugs flew in there as the table it sat on was right by a window. 

Our server also gave off an Italian vibe, with an accent and hand gestures to match. He was the only one serving, so mych attention was paid to the larger party that was already there. We placed our orders about 15 min. later. 

We ordered: 

Bruschetta: Nothing fancy or outstanding about this. Wife can make it much better. But we were hungry by 2:30pm so it was devoured.

Combo pizza: The crust was not like anything I had in Italy. It was thicker, had doughy ends and again, tasted very average. 

Veal parmesan: It didn't seem like veal, but more like meat that was fed through the tenderizer a few times, like how places make chicken fried steak. It was topped with a slice of cheese w/ no flavor and served with tube pasta. Average

Lasagna: I feel like I'm repeating myself too much, but this was average also. Heavily drenched in tomato sauce.

None of the dishes gave off any memorable flavors or detectable herbs. The sauces were one dimensional and the flavors did nothing to wow us. As we sat, more people came in and service became increasingly slower. Water glasses were not filled and we even had to wait for the check. This was simply a place to fill our hunger, not somuch to taste great cuisine. Although our meal didn't turn out awful, I highly doubt we'll return. If I play tourists again, it's very likely we'll plan ahead and go elsewhere.
author: James L.

description:
In the end, the problem was the greasy doorman Michelangelo's used to employ, Tony. I mentioned him in my first review after he tried to attack me and stole my iPhone with Salvatore and the rest of the restaurants' waitstaff posse. Tony was consistently creating problems between passersby, neighbors, and the restaurant (owned by Salvatore and his family).

Salvatore had generously given Tony many chances with the doorman gig since Tony had been repeatedly harassing pedestrians, but finally, with Tony's departure, Salvatore and I were able to make amends.

Unfortunately, Tony remains a plague on the neighborhood. I'm sympathetic towards his immigrant father who runs a luxury rug store nearby in North Beach on Grant St. because his son rejects his proud Afghani heritage simply to work in Little Italy as a "fake Italian" guido mascot attracting tourists to other Italian-owned family businesses. It's a sad situation for Tony Sr. running his rig shop on his own, so let's all hope Tony Jr. learns to accept himself and his ethnic identity, grows up to maturity, and helps his father out sometime before Tony Jr's upcoming 60th birthday!
author: Melvin S.

description: Was looking for Fruitti de Mare in Little Italy and gave this place a try. All the staff are welcoming and friendly. The dinner and dessert were delicious. The chef came out to ask how our dinner was. I'll definitely come back!
author: Laura D.

description:
This place was just eh. The waiter wasn't very friendly and seemed bothered when we asked to split the check. The spaghetti sauce was bland and the meatballs were not very good. Bread was hard and the pizza was just okay....it's hard to mess up
pizza. I wouldn't eat here again.
author: Alexis N.

description: Best place. Had two dinners for groups of 25 to 30 people. Food amazing service out of this world
author: Tracey K.

description: Great tasting Italian food. Chef came to table to chat and visit. Brings back memories of many Italy vacations.
author: Silke A.

description: Food was hit and miss, free garlic bread was good. No bar. House Merlot wasn't very good. Service was good but they didn't want to split checks beyond 2. Atmosphere was ok, lots of dean martin music.
author: Luke M.

description: A great spontaneous find in the city. It's not hard to find great Italian in SF but we went in on a time crunch and had amazing food, great service and were out in time to catch our show. Even though they had a large party inside we did not feel neglected. I definitely recommend going and will be back again.
author: Kelly T.

description: This is a long overdue review of one of our favorite restaurants in the city. I eat here when in town on business, probably 30-50 times over 15 year. Yea, it's a little tight, the staff aren't "friendly" (I'll take professionally competent over friendly any day), parking's a nightmare, bathroom is a challenge but, big deal, these negatives, such as they are, are part of the charm. Food is great, from the chewy, fresh bread, to the unbelievably rich Chicken Milanese, to the homemade pasta, to the gratis Amaretto cookies, yada yada yada. A local, one of a kind, non touristy, treasure that I'm glad I found.
author: David D.

description: Great dinner. Food is excellent. Not an easy place to find parking during dinner time. Service is fast , but he don't have any recommendation for the type of food. I ask if he would suggest what is good, and he answer everything is good. I just order seafood, and it turn out great. Definitely I will be back again to try other dishes. After the end of dinner they gave a plate of gummy bear, and kid sure love it a lots.
author: Ray K.

description:
Michelangelo has been one of my favorite Italian restaurants ! Food it's always so good! 
Alberto the server it's the best! He's very friendly and nice person! 
I highly recommend this place to people who love good Italian food!
author: Helen E.

description: Great food with an amazing decor. The waiters treated us like old friends and was an amazing experience would recommend!! It's a little small, but the owner cares a lot and takes great pride in the restaurant. Will definitely be coming back.
author: Matt S.

description:
Visiting San Francisco with my family and walked past this intriguing looking place. The man out front stopped my uncle and chatted for a few minutes before we decided we would stay. Ordered a few glasses of wine for Happy Hour and had their meat/cheese antipasta plate. It was awesome! Their Penne Rivera had what seemed to be fifteen clams and plenty of shrimp. Most Italian restaurants never have pappardelle, which is one of my favorite pastas, and they had it mixed with peas,mushroom, and sausage in a sort of bolognese. The tiramisu was amazing as well as this iced/custard sort of dessert that came served inside a hollowed out lemon. Just all around great food and atmosphere. We ended up stopping gay a second time the next day because it was all so good.

Now for the service. I'm not sure why others complained so much about the staff. Sure they aren't the "smiley/overt friendly," type of servers you get at a chain restaurant, but they aren't rude. They are direct and to the point and check on you if it looks like you need something. If not, they are going to leave you to socialize. They offered up advice on the best dishes and made small talk. 

Definitely stop by for some authentic food, but don't expect "friendly, upbeat" servers who are only faking it because they are following corporate mandated policy. If you want that type of service, go to Olive Garden.
author: Mike L.

description: Visited San Francisco last weekend and was craving for a seafood pasta dish so our friends took us here.  I loved their Fettuccine Mare E Monti (mushroom, peas, scallops and shrimp sautéed in tomato cream sauce) sprinkle some chili flakes if you want extra zing! OMG, I'm still dreaming about it!
author: Joyce V.

description: Reasonable and wait staff were very attentive ..there's 10 of us and reserved it the last minute and we were accomodated.  They were patient enough this new year's eve to let us stay a little longer. We are totally coming back ...hello Tony
author: Jing F.

description: A hidden gem, that we would have ignored but for the gentleman outside telling us about the menue.  Small and intimate with a great Italian food.  A must try if you are around the Columbus area.
author: Larry C.

description: Just finished a terrific meal at Michelangelo's. Started with the special brushetta appetizer, enjoyed white clam pasta and beef bolanese. The food was delicious but what really stood out was the exception service and friendliness of the staff. Don't pass this gem by!
author: Veronica C.

description:
We would have given 3.5 but no such beast. So we decided on 4 in context.
In context of it being....
--Hottest day in San Francisco in decades (101 degrees today)
--Saturday night
--Lots of tourists
We're local so we or a change of tend to be picky and take the local and numerous places for haute cuisine for granted. But we wandered to North Beach for a change of pace from our own neighborhood. This place was recommended by a nearby millinery shop.
The ambiance is Michelangelo-esque, with huge bas Relief staring you down from every wall but thanks to the Tiffany lamps, we won't have nightmares tonight.  Hubble describes it as North Beach classic kitsch.
The owner was all business but when I asked he suggested the seafood pasta. Hubble ordered penne puttanesca. We shared spinach salad. Tasty, filling, not amazing but satisfying.
Prices very reasonable.
What helped to earn the extra half star were the complimentary cookies and gummy bears. (Who serves gummy bears these days???)
author: Liana T.

description:
Bland. Bland  bland 
Order the calamari and lambs chops 
It was not what I expected 
No flavor 
Service was decent 
Other than that 
Won't come back anytime 
Soon
author: Hieu N.

description:
Full disclosure: A lot of my feelings are based on nostalgia.

Tortellini is fantastic, smooth, sweet sauce, nice ham chunks. I always love the bread because of the unlimited olive oil/vinegar bottles they give you. Everything else though? Most of the meals taste unseasoned, and many of the sauces are unreasonably runny. Great customer service, communicative and knowledgable about the art. However, poor, endgame, a lot of times I felt like I was hanging by the amount of time it took to get the check. Avoid the bowls of gummies instead of the plate of gummies and those gnarly wallpapers cookies.

Will go back, because this was a big part of my childhood, but only ordering tortellini.
author: First Name L.

description: Great food, wine and gummy bears at check out.  What more could you want?!?!  Service is fantastic and there is no wait!  A great way to spend Chrismas Ece!
author: Malcolm B.

description: I used to come here every time I was in the city but it was different this time, empty on a Saturday. Food ok bread was cold. Server sat talking to some guys in the back the entire time we had to flag him down over and over and it took 15 solid minutes to get our check then the worst part of all NO GUMMY BEARS!!!  sadly that will be my last visit!
author: Colleen Z.

description: Absolutely not impressed! We come to SF every year and look forward to the (usually) great food there. Our favorite go-to Italian restaurant has unfortunately closed so we tried this place. After spending $100+ on two glasses of wine, antipasto and two entrees, we left and swore we wouldn't be back. Food very average and I probably could do better in my own kitchen.
author: Linda S.

description: A true Italian restaurant (in my opinion)! We had went on a Saturday and it wasn't busy at all. We had tried this place based off of another recommendation and we weren't disappointed. The caprese appetizer is super fresh so I recommend trying that. Overall it was a little pricey but I feel appropriate for our portion sizes, which I had to ask for a Togo box because of it (win!) The staff was welcoming and friendly and the owner came out to our table once to thank us. Great place I recommend forsure!
author: Rachel N.

description:
Great food, great environment. Family owned neighborhood Italian, restaurant. We had
The tortellini Michelangelo, very nice rich cream sauce.
Must visit if your looking for a traditional Italian.
Will be back next time I'm in San Francisco
author: Casey R.

description:
This is a wonderful Italian restaurant and warrants a higher rating than the current (3) stars!!  We were going to another place that was rated higher but found the atmosphere and the food more attractive here.....the salads were fresh and lively...the calamari was delicately fried and had a light tomato sauce....service was outstanding and food was served promptly...

we enjoyed the spaghetti n meatballs, eggplant parmigiana and another entree, i can't remember....it was all terrific and we will be back when in north beach....

oh yeah....so we were going to another place for gelato and so asked for the check and they brought us a little plate of small biscotti and gummy bears!!  my GF was in heaven...she loves gummy bears and they're the good ones!!
author: Doug U.

description:
Homey feel, world class food:

We loved Michaelangelo caffe.  The staff greeted our party of 10 like family.  We enjoyed the atmosphere of a small homey restaurant like we were really in Italy.  And the food was superb.  The seafood pasta was great, sea bass special was cooked perfectly, fried calamari was light and airy, the portions were generous and the tiramisu and mini Canolis were to die for -- made by hand by the owner.  We highly recommend it!
author: Tanya H.

description:
Terrible service! 
Fake Italian restaurant!! The dishes were not what we expect at all!
The manager was rude with us and with all the tables, and was for all the entire time we were there quarrelling loudly with the young waiter!
Was very bad experience.
I definitely don't gonna come back.
author: Gloria S.

description: Everything from the over cooked pizza (almost burnt and hard) to the undercooked pasta (with a whole bunch of sauce)  left me with a bad impression. The seemingly nice environment drew me in (they have nice stone work and a cool view of an old church and coit tower in the distance). The first waiter we had was really nice but the older gentleman (who spoke Italian) was not very nice at all and we had to wait forever for him to take our orders and bring us the check. I wouldn't recommend this place  based on the food alone. Pizza was around 16 dollars but tasted worse than Little Cesar's and had an even worse texture. Great location but the food and service were subpar.
author: Irving T.

description:
Although this place doesn't look like much, I was super content with my $12 gluten free (and celiac friendly) fettuccine! 

No, it didn't come with the side salad as stated on the menu, and there wasn't any complimentary dessert like other reviewers mentioned. But $12 for a big bowl of pasta in San Francisco? I was happy! Best of all, there was no up charge for the gluten free pasta! It was more food than I could eat and definitely the best fettuccine alfredo I'd had in years! 

If you don't want to wait an hour for gluten free pizza at the famous place across the street, this place isn't a bad back-up. And heck, if I lived in San Francisco, I'd eat the alfredo pasta here weekly! And then gain 50 lbs but it'd be worth it.
author: Kate L.

description:
Located in little Italy area of San Francisco. Wanted to get a dessert at another restaurant. One of the waiters stopped us on the street. He got our attention. I was a pinch reluctant to give this place a try.

The staff was patient and friendly. Attentive were the staff listening to our requests. Water was served and menus were delivered. 

We ordered a tropical gelato treat and a tiramisu. The gelato was smooth, the white chocolate crust was a nice, a unique blend of tropical fruit. The tiramisu was light, decent custard, and mostly balance. The cake was soft. Neither was overly sweet. Each were distinct in their own. 

Check was settled quick.

Overall decent was this place. Murals and statues on walls add to allure. 

Bad this place was just okay.

I would come here again with all things considering.
author: Denny T.

description: Found this by accident as we're walking up Columbus. Great Italian food, excellent service. The food is not overloaded with sauces or over flavored. Just the right amount of subtle flavors of tomatoes, garlic, Olive oil, and white wine. You can distinctly taste the individual ingredients and herbs. The clams and the shrimps were just perfect. We walked out of there feeling very satisfied, and not over stuffed. We'll certainly be back, maybe in a week or so. I wish they had a location in the East Bay.
author: John P.

description: Love the food, love the service, the gummy bears and cookies at the end are on point. Ask for some limoncello to go with your cookies. It might not be on the menu but they have it!
author: Debra J.

description:
The food was a let down. Either we ordered the worst items on their menu or they were just having a bad day. My husband (a professional cook) ordered the Chicken & Sausage and here's his take: "It was supposed to be a simple and classic dish that really highlights what's best about Italian food. It was executed in the laziest possible fashion. Chicken breast had no sear to it and the sausage, potatoes, and mushrooms were not browned at all. In general, colorless and bland. There was just no love put into it." (I personally thought his dish tasted like Chinese food, especially the sauce and the steamed broccoli.)

We also shared the carpaccio, which, similar to the chicken and sausage, seemed phoned in. Again, it was the little things they didn't do that made it mediocre. Simple stuff like not seasoning the beef.
 
I ordered Cioppino which was served in a plastic salad bowl. The clams and shrimps tasted fresh, but the rest of the seafood was rubbery (either poorly cooked or were frozen.) They did hook me up with a lot of clams though, so I appreciate that! The sauce was also kinda bland. We were served gummy bears for dessert which was unusual but probably one of the best parts of the whole meal. 

The Italian family next to us ordered pizzas and appeared to enjoy it a lot so I'm guessing it'd be the best suggestion if you're planning to visit this place.

In terms of customer service, our waiter was very friendly and prompt, but the host was a little cold so I can see how that may come off as rude to the previous reviewers.
author: Michelle B.

description:
OUTSTANDING  5+  STARS
Michelangelo Ristorante is awesome!  If you want an excellent Italian meal in an authentic family style environment, this is your place. They do get busy, being on the corner in front of the beautiful church in Columbus square. My suggestion, call ahead to let Salvatori (the owner) or Tony know the time you will arrive and perhaps request a window seat facing the park.  Great view of Coit Tower!

We've been eating here for years, and have been wanting to write this review for a long time, so finally I can share this wonderful place with you.

My colleagues and I consider dining at Michealanglo's Cafe to be an event. We drive over an hour from San Jose, sometimes 2 hours in traffic, but well worth it to see Salvatori's smile and open arms when we walk through the door....

He is such a good guy, one time we left at closing, but we forgot our car keys. Salvatori waited past midnight for us to eventually show-up because he knew we could not drive back to San Jose without the keys!  This tells you what kind of caring and considerate individual the owner is.
 
Now for the Food .... my favorite dishes:
 
Prosciutto e melon - excellent appetizer 
Pappardelle Boscaiola - outstanding
Wild salmon - when available, amazing sauce
Lamb shank - out of this world
 

Desserts:
Bomba - ridiculously delicious 
Chocolate cream puffs - so rich
Tiramisu- Incredible, especially with bomba

Gummy bears - that's a dessert story in-it-of-itself. Ask Salvatori to share it when those treats arrive on your table

All in all, Michelangelo's Cafe  is Fantastico !   Solid 5+ *****'  There is no better authentic Italian cuisine in S.F

(From my friend)... The food was absolutely amazing.  This was my colleague's first time here and he will definitely be here again.  Try anything on the menu and you will not be disappointed.
author: Vic M.

description:
Great food and great service. Real Italian food
That's all I ve got to say. 
These people actually know what Italian food should taste like.
author: Angie A.

description: Nice and tasty.  Simple menu, but ask for the special.  We orders the tasty penne pasta and the salmon special. Definately coming back.
author: Jesse H.

description: Dropped in for an early dinner late lunch around 3pm yesterday 7/16 with 3 out of town friends. The place was empty. We had to ask for drinks, we had to ask to order the meals, nothing came to our way without a request. The happy hour pricing was not honored without asking, no split check either. I was embarrassed for recommending the place to our friends. I can't recommend to anybody. Food is actually decent, but service was below any charts. A side note, as we were ready to leave, some tables started to fill. The waiter brought in two plates with creamy sauce to the table next to ours. As he was standing next to the table the sauce from the plate was dripping all over the floor. One of the ladies at the table was yelling heyheyhey, the waiter finally noticed and started cleaning the mess and handing the plates to the ladies  As I said service sucks out loud!!!
author: Salla V.

description:
Im giving a 5 star rating only because of the assistant waiter Alberto. The main waiter wasn't very friendly and seemed annoyed we used a Groupon but Alberto made up for it with his kind personality and attentive demeanor. The food was just "good" but the tiramisu was amazing!!! Thanks for the recommendation Alberto ;)
Note to owner/main waiter....don't participate in Groupon if you don't like it when people use them. Next piece of advice...make Albert a waiter. He's the best employee you've got.
author: Maggie V.

description:
I was exploring Little Italy with 3 girlfriends when we saw the happy hour sign outside of this cute little restaurant. It was around 4 pm and happy hour just started so we decided to stop here for a few glasses of wine and appetizers. When we were seated by the waiter, the four of us were the only souls in the restaurant. But the restaurant was beautiful and had a lovely Italian ambience and we were seated right by the window for prime people watching. 

When we told the waiter that we wanted appetizers and wine, he was visibly irritated and literally rolled his eyes. When he brought our wine and food out, he grunted and slammed our items on the table. We had to call him over every time we needed to order another round because he never came back to check on us. We were all extremely uncomfortable each time he served us. The wine and food was delicious, but not worth the discomfort of having such rude service! The bill was over $100 and although I am usually a generous tipper, I felt compelled to only leave $5. If he hadn't been so rude, he would have gotten the tip that he so clearly anticipated he wouldn't receive. Honestly, having four good looking girls by the window is good for business and we ordered plenty to justify his time and service. We left this restaurant disappointed and regretting not stopping at the happy hour next door. 

My advice to this restaurant: hire friendlier waiters that don't mind working happy hour or don't offer happy hour at all!
author: Amy E.

description: We had a reservation here. Service was speedy and quick. Complementary garlic bread and bruschetta. Between the 6 of us, there were 4 different dishes and everything tasted wonderful. The decor is...something to be seen. The price of the food was fair and in line with what you would expect. We didn't get any complementary gummy bears though like some of the other reviewers :( Wap Wap Oh well. Still good.
author: Shayer S.

description: Terrible service and the food was simply plain and tasted like nothing! I sent back the pasta alla carbonara and they still try to charge me for it, the server never asked me if I wanted something else and when I complained about getting charged the response from the manager was "yeah ok whatever" Not worth stopping by here, plenty of better options in the neighborhood
author: Nick B.

description:
We were late for a reservation that we had at another place nearby, so we had to find another restaurant for a Friday night dinner date. 
We came to this restaurant as a waiter lured us in. 
Our overall impression was that the interior was very unique with different Roman sculptures. We loved how they provided complimentary bruschetta and cookies at the end of the meal. However, the food itself was strange... 
My boyfriend's seafood pasta was in a watered-down tomato sauce and my clam vongole was also watery. This was our first time having Italian food with watery sauce. On the menu, it read 'broth' so we just assumed that they purposely made the dish like that. However, I still prefer my pasta to be saucy and creamy rather than watery. 2-stars for the awesome service and the enjoyable time we had as a dinner date.
author: Brenda Jiwon L.

description: Michelangelo Ristorante has delicious food and fast, friendly service. They were very nice and accommodating when we wanted to sit outside. One of the best Italian restaurants in the bay!
author: Lauren G.

description:
DOES NOT ACCEPT GROUPONS! 
Came in with a Groupon and the waiter first stated "your groupon has expired." it clearly stated September 5, 2017 and we went on September 4, 2017. I stated today is Sept 4 and it says Sept 5. He then proceeded to say we don't accept Groupon on holidays. Then stated we don't take Groupons because we had a change of ownership. Started to seem like he was just making excuses. He eventually stated he would talk to the manager then came back and said that they would accept the Groupon. 

The food was okay but overpriced without a Groupon and for dessert you get gummy bears? Even Chinese restaurants don't go that cheap on desserts! 

To the manager, if you guys don't accept Groupons anymore then CONTACT GROUPON. Your waiters don't get paid enough to put up with customers complaining about Groupons. 

Would not come back. Bad management and no parking and it was stuffy and hot inside the restaurant with no AC or ventilation.
author: Jessica W.

description: The service is really bad, spaghetti bolognese - worst I've ever tried. The stuff kept rushing as some people were waiting for the table, even though we had still wine to drink. I do not recommend this place.
author: Oli K.

description: I dined at Michaelangelo for the first time back in 1983.  This is now a dump of a completely different restaurant.  Avoid this place like the plague.  You cannot have worse service or worse food.  The Ciopino smelled like the sewer.  The lamb chops were leather chops.  The bathrooms fealthy and rude ignorant staff just did not even care to do the basics.  I do not know how they manage to stay in business.  My stomach is churning as I write this.
author: Seama Z.

description: Wonderful true Italian cuisine.  We had  gnocchi's, and lasagna and the house chianti.  Fabulous!  The interior design  reminded us of restaurants in Rome and Venice.  The chef is as welcoming as the food.'
author: Louann R.

description:
SERVICE WAS AMAZING!

They started our meal with complimentary bruscetta and ended it with a plate full of almond cookies and gummy bears. I thought it was cute. Food was delicious!
author: Camilla G.

description: This restaurant is trying to be authentic but it isn't. They only make their own ravioli and lasagna pasta - which come from the same flat rolled pasta. We got complimentary olive oil and balsamic vinegar with bread . The olive oil was not virgin and had little flavor. I will say it was fresh though. The balsamic vinegar, which is traditionally very smooth, caught me in the back of my throat. The bread was boring and basic. The marinara was nothing to write home about. At the end they gave you complimentary almond cookies and gummy bears. Gummy bears? Crazy.
author: Italiano 5.

description:
Ahhhhh, Michelangelo! Not a negative thought enters my mind when I dream of going back here. Any excuse is good enough to venture into this divine slice of Italy on the west coast! Salvatore is an excellent host, checking on each table himself, making sure every guest is happy and content. One time i ventured in to dine alone on a stopover since I had 6 hours before going on to Seattle. Salvatore was an absolute doll. He filled my wine glass and my tummy and sent me off to Seattle with a bag full of Amaretto cookies!
The Gnocchi are handmade(there is even a YouTube video out there to see for yourself.) the Saltimbocca is delish!  Fresh CRUSTY bread, large portions, great attentive service. See you soon Salvatore!
author: Elayne L.

description:
Not the cosiest spot, but authentic. Food was very good&fresh, prices reasonable, service exemplary.
Having in the meantime had other dinners at two well-known SF-restaurants where both times, service was bad, I must add again that service at Michelangelo's was really good and attentive!
author: Duck W.

description: Great pizza and even better service. This is a charming cafe in the heart of Little Italy. My son wanted pesto pizza, but it wasn't on the menu. The chef made it especially for him anyway. They end every meal with a complimentary plate of Italian cookies and gummy bears! Kids were very happy.
author: Ashley D.

description:
OMG!!! Had the Pollo Alla Milanese... So freakin good, yummy, excellent!!! 
Atmosphere is quaint... Owner was the guy in the back cooking all dishes... 
Would've gave them 5 stars, but for some reason we (my 3 year old daughter & wifey) did not recieve the same type of service as everyone else... Dont Know? But the food was truly excellent!!! Give it a try...
author: John D.

description: Just had dinner with my girl friend.  After walking by dozens of crowded and busy restaurants, we settled on this one.  The gentleman outside explained how the owner himself comes in everyday to make the sauces. I definitely would recommend this place.
author: Edi S.

description:
By chance we end up walking to North Beach last night. While walking, the nice man from the door invited us to come in the restaurant and started making conversation with us. He convinced us. We sat at the table and as is typical when I get to a place before dinner time I asked for the Happy hour menu - I asked for it for drinks not food, I'm assuming my server thought I wanted to eat cheap, not the case. This infuriated our server who gave us the worst attitude, he even started arguing with me that they only had happy hour red wine and white "THAT'S IT" he replied. We then got water for the table, one of the glasses was noticeable dirty and we kindly asked to have it replaced, again the server got upset and was then when we decided to leave. 
We didn't get to try the food, but it was obvious this server was having a terrible day and make us had a terrible experience.
On our way out the nice man at the door asked about what had just happened, he apologized. 
We left the place to never come back.
author: Gaby B.

description:
A disappointing shadow of its former self. The roving giant Parmesan wheel is gone, the mussels and clams were super small, the chicken Parm was soggy and in a flavorless red sauce. Pizza would have been ok except it kept falling apart and the prosciutto was awful (not Parma for sure). Lame beer selection would be a super easy fix. Stella, Bud Light, Becks and Peroni--in sf?  please!  

We won't be back.
author: David P.

description:
It was a perfect Italian Dinner. All the food is amazing. From the bread to the spinach salad Cioppino Risotto Gnocchi with meat sauce and my Cafe Latte. 

The staff is all Italian Friendly Nice Attentive. The owner makes the sauce and cooks for you. 

I would highly recommend this place and will definitely come back next time I'm in the area.
author: Jenn R.

description:
Absolutely one of the best authentic Italian restaurants I've had in a very long time! 

Being half Italian it's hard for me to find a place that reminds me of my family's cooking and taste authentic. 

The son of the restaurant owner was standing outside greeted us told us about the restaurant it was warm, it was inviting. 

The food was absolutely amazing! My boyfriend and I took two of our nieces here, both in high school and both pretty picky when it comes to food, yet they enjoyed the food so much. Clean plates all around! 

I will definitely be coming back and bringing so many more people to this amazing family owned restaurant. 
I highly recommend trying this place!
author: Sarah P.

description: Above and beyond service. I have never been so impressed with a restaurant! Great service and great food. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who enjoys amazing Italian food. Best service in the city.
author: Madison S.

description:
Good coffee and cold beer on a hot day. Pretty interesting place with cool interior and friendly staff. Will visit again. Nice view of the park/church in from of it. Great for people watching. Remember to bring our creeper sunglasses. Minus one for closing early but that's how Italian coffee shops are run I suppose.

Cheers.
author: Thomas S.

description: The service was outstanding! Such energy and attentive service! My family (2 adults 2 children) had the lasagna, Fettuccine Mari E Monti, and margarita pizza. Everything was delicious and cooked to perfection!
author: Kim C.

description: Very nice interior, but very boorish staff. Threw plates for no reason, refused to issue a check, rude. Was just a nice young man with a big plate of cheese.
author: Oleg K.

description: Nicest staff, best gnocchi... Literally like pillows in my mouth!!! They're so genuinely friendly it actually made me happier. And gummi bears once we received the check!
author: Jessica P.

description:
Yes, we were tourists.  Yes, the waiter on the street greeted us and claimed they have the "best Italian in SF".  Yes, their decor is cliched Italian kitsch, but that was kinda fun.  They'd just opened for lunch so we gave it a try.

The service was attentive (we were the only ones in the restaurant for about 30 minutes) but not hovering.  Our salads were not worth the price for the portion size and lack of creativity.  DH wasn't impressed with his pasta dish (concoction of meats with red sauce) but everyone else was satisfied.  

We've had much better Italian in our hometown (Portland, OR) so I wouldn't recommend Michelangelo's based on our one visit.  It was better than Olive Garden but that's not much of a compliment.  None of us suffered ill effects afterward so it's three stars for Michaelangelo's.
author: Tina P.

description: This place was amazing!!  Great food, great staff, we had an amazing time here.  The ambiance was absolutely perfect.  I had the lasagna, never ate anything as good as that before.  They give you a free appetizer (bruschetta). The best I have ever had!!  Just amazing
author: Jenny P.

description: Very small place & was pulled in by the son of the owner. So glad we bugged. This place was great! I had the gnocchi & it was amazing! I spoke the owner & his son & both are super friendly!
author: Paris H.

description:
If you want a quiet place to have an dinner this is the place to go. 

It is a subpar pasta place. My poor pappardelle dish was lacking salt and the pasta was stuck together. 

The best part of my meal was the dessert.

The Tiramisu was yummy and a good portion.   The coffee was tasty and strong. 

Complementary gummy bears and amaretti cookies is always a plus.  

As for service, it was just okay. They didn't tell us the specials and ask us if we wanted anything to drink like they did the other customers that came in after us.
author: Teresa S.

description: We had amazing service. I got ravioli and the noodles were very obviously homemade. Authentic entrees, great wine and music. All around great experience, and I'd come here again
author: Sam S.

description: Amazing family night at this restaurant. Super authentic Italian food. Their seafood pasta is the best around. Fun and friendly staff!
author: Camille L.

description: This place was horrible!  Rude ass waiter! Not authentic Italian food, this place was so bland. There are a lot waay better option, don't waste your money here.
author: Ginger D.

description:
Found this place via a deal on Groupon. My boyfriend and I love this place and it definitely deserves more love! Being that my boyfriend grew up eating real Italian food made by his family, he actually really loves this place! 

I always order the Fettuccine Mari E Monti and it's so, so delicious! They give you the right amount of pasta and the quality of it all is on point. Fresh pasta + seafood = WIN. KUDDOS for free brushetta, olives, bread, gummy bears, and cookies! 

The staff is really friendly and are very courteous.
author: Shela D.

description: We were walking by and Tony talked us into trying them out. He offered us Bruschetta and Dessert. He got us with the Gummy Bears and fresh homemade daily pasta sauces. It was a well decorated restaurant but not cozy in any way. The TV airing the Warriors game was not HD but it was nice to be able to at least watch the game over dinner. All the food we had was really good from the Bruschetta, warm bread, Chicken Marsala and Pappardelle Alla Boscaiola (ground sausage black olives peas and portobello mushroom in tomato sauce). The sauce on the pasta was delicious. It wasn't too tomatoey nor salty and there were lots of mushromms. The marsala sauce can be a bit too sweet at other places but it was not here. When dessert came, we were a little full but they let us take it home. They were little almond flavored cookies and gummy bears. The cookies were really good. The service was friendly and attentive. We'd go back for the warm bread and fresh pasta sauces. Funny that we've been eating in North Beach for over 20 years but never thought to stop in here.
author: Jen L.

description:
The olives that they serve were fantastic! So authentic and tasty. 
I ordered the eggplant parm and it left a lot to be desired. The sauce that was on it tasted like they opened a can of sauce and poured it over the eggplant. It came with potatoes which lacked flavor or seasoning. The broccoli was very good.

Kids had pizza which tasted good but was small for the price ($20).  My husband had a seafood pasta in a tomato sauce that was good.

For dessert, they brought cookies and gummy bears; nice touch!  
Service was pretty good.  

All that said, I probably wouldn't go back because of lack of flavor in my dish.  A bit of spices or more effort and I would reconsider.
author: lisa s.

description:
WE were headed toward a differnt place, nice man from restaurant was standing in front 
and offered us a look at the menue- told us he would take very good care of us. Bring us some Bruchetta from him.  It was only 6:30 and place was not very busy, but wer wre hungry so we gave it a try.  Great windown seat with view of tower and Church. Bruchetta was very good and Wine very nice. We really enjoyed both dinners- A Lasaga that was amazing and hubby had
Veal Piccata Al Limone I think. He ate every bite and used the good bread with the rest of the suace.  The art and Decor is really fun as well, wait staf friendly and accomodating - Manager checked on us as well. Cannot ask for much more.
author: Jean D.

description: Service was amazing and the food was FABULOUS!  4 in our party on Sunday late afternoon. We all had something different and everything was excellent! The cioppino was exceptionally good. Basic variety of clams, mussels, shrimp and squid but the broth was to die for! Every sauce on every dish was exceptional especially the chicken funghi! The prices were reasonable and the service spot on! SALUTE!
author: Dan J.

description: Great dinner!  We started with the calamari and they were lightly coated and fried perfectly, very tender. My husband and I both had the Eggplant Parmigiana and if was fantastic. Great service!!  Would definitely go back!
author: MaryAnn M.

description: Cozy cafe! Their lasagna was delicious. Their service could've been a bit better, but overall good cafe. Location is great!
author: Anthony M.

description:
Found this gem after a date to Beach Blanket Babylon.  The greeter outside was nice and convinced us to come in. 

We get in and the art on the wall was just beautiful.  We were honored to have the owner serving us and telling us about the store and history.  The food was just excellent! I had ravioli with Bolognese sauce and my girlfriend had ordered the steak with portobello mushrooms.   Delicious!!! 

I would definitely recommend it to anyone who wants some good Italian food after a night out.  Perfect spot and excellent food.  Definitely making my way there again.
author: Ryan K.

description: Lovely little family-run Italian restaurant.  The owner and the son are very personable. The service was excellent and the interior ambiance is striking.  The price is very reasonable making it one of the best values on the street. The food however, is a little bland but still good.  I had the veil saltimbocca and my two guest had the veil parmigiana both were a little bland.  The desserts are some of the best we have ever had.  Michelangelo's gets and "A" for service, "A" for value, and a "B" for food.
author: A J H.

description: Good place. Good food, however you have a bunch of options nearby. It missed the calzone on the menu as well as pizza to go. Am I wrong to ask pizza to go even after have eaten a pollo à parmigiana?
author: Carlos H.

description: I will NEVER come back here again. The server was the worst he had a really bad attitude and was just negative. He messed up all three of my orders salad, lasagna, and meherita pizza. First the salad I specified that I wanted romaine lettuce, cucumbers, and onions only then I get a ceasar salad which is completely opposite of what I said. Then the lasagna was really watery and didn't even taste like lasagna. The pizza came out as a plain cheese missing all the other condiments like the tomatoes and basil that it should have. I explained this to the server and he replied that I leave and didn't even apologize for his rudeness.
author: Eric J.

description: the olives that come before your meal are absolutely amazing... and free! we came during happy hour so we got $5 prosecco's and moscato's. the antipasto plate was an assortment of cheese, meats, and some marinated veggies = very yummy! the clams & muscles in a lemon garlic sauce was super delicious. definitely recommend it.
author: Amanda O.

description: Great service all around. Tony was a great opener to this amazing restaurant. The atmosphere is calm and collective and the food was great. Me and my friend had a great little girls night dinner here!
author: Vhaeda D.

description: Food was mediocre.  Service linda slow and sloppy.  Wait staff nice but to me the food has to be fab to endure their service woes.  Food isn't at all fab.
author: Roger W.

description:
Michelangelo's isn't the best Italian food you'll ever eat. It's not even the best Italian food in North Beach, but it's a classic and it's a fun place to visit. The waiters are usually very nice, if not a little hurried and busy.

Olives, bread and oil, and brushetta come standard before your meal. Our main meals were decent, but nothing to write home about. But of course, our girls LOVED the gummy bears at the end of the meal. 

That's really the whole reason we came...those dang gummy bears get you every time. :)
author: Alexis M.

description: Had another wonderful meal at this magical but loud spot. Food is Great, authentic and home made. I tried the beef ravioli special this time and it was prrrretyy tasty.   I've also had the Spaghetti Allo Scoglio$19.00 ; prawns, scallops, clams, calamari and mussels served over spaghetti in a light tomato sauce. I don't think you can order a bad meal here. The atmosphere is festive so if you're on a stuffy first date situation, you should try a more quiet restaurant unless you're date is gregarious because odds are, you'll be sharing a table with other Italian food lovers.
author: Patrick S.

description: Bread was very hard... they say that everything is homemade but nothing is homemade... food quality is pathetic.. the manager just stands in the entrance and waves to people instead of paying attention to the people who are sitting inside... he is very very rude.. waiter service is pathetic... please refrain from going to this restaurant
author: Ishita S.

description:
We were LIED TO!

Used a Groupon. Very friendly, Italian-spirited service. Almost a little too friendly (remember "Bellisima!!" from SNL?). We were greeted and seated quickly. Ordered wine and the clams, which were really simple, and good.

Then the server (owner?) told us about the Halibut Special, which he said he "got fresh from the fish market just yesterday." Wow, can't beat that, we thought, especially having grown up in Alaska where halibut reigns the dinner plate.

So we ordered the cioppino and the halibut, and out came a bowl of cioppino...and tilapia. It was DEFINITELY tilapia and NOT halibut.

Being lied to was a let down, but we happened to be in good spirits and it didn't cause any lasting damage. We didn't even bother to say anything to the establishment, as it may have ignited something dangerous, who knows.
author: Charles B.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised by the delicious olive assortment given to you with bread, oil, and vinegar. I ordered the Pesto Gnocchi, which was very good and really filling.  My friend ordered the veggie panini, but thought she would prefer to pick something else next time. I would definitely get the gnocchi again.   The service was very nice, came often enough, and was friendly without being over bearing.   I enjoyed the ambiance and felt like I could have been back in Italy. Good view of the park. 

I'd give it a try.
author: kathryn h.

description: Food was kinda bland but decent portions. I had the veal parmesan and could taste the flour in the breading and too much cheese baked directly on top. The cheese looked like a velveta slice? I asked for a side of spaghetti which had fairly tart Marina sauce poured over it which was generous in the amount of sauce. My fiancé got the pesto gnocchi which was ok. The sourdough  bread was ok but not amazing. We had a groupon deal $25 for $40 worth of food. Not bad if you don't want to spend a fortune. Maybe the other dishes are better? Wasn't thrilled with what I ate.
author: Frank T.

description: Great place! Everyone here is so friendly and the food is delicious. They give you free garlic bread and bruschetta before your meal and free dessert. The gnocchi is delicious and the owner told us he comes in at 5am everyday and makes his own homemade sauces.
author: Dianne M.

description: We were heavily recruited in to the restaurant by the extremely pushy door man .  Food was ok but service and attitude of the server and staff was not friendly. Not a place on my list to revisit
author: Anne K.

description:
Italian radio in the background, the host and the waiters faking Italian accent, flies above my head and most importantly the food - overpriced mediocre "Italian" food. 
I ordered Chicken with Italian Sausage and mushrooms - chicken breast was as thin as carton paper, sausage didn't seem like it was homemade and mushrooms were like ... mushrooms.
Three stars - because the service was excellent. We were with a baby in a stroller, and they accommodated all our needs. The host was attentive, waiters patient, fast and responsive to eye-contact.
author: Vahe S.

description:
Where do I begin to start...
Tony took my reservation earlier that evening over the phone, we arrived 15 minutes earlier and he sat us down in the last table available even being early for our reservation, place was full!!!!
My gnocchi was definitely the best I had in San Francisco so far.  Our server Stefan kept me satisfied with extra parmesan cheese and they have an awesome wine selection!!! Will be coming back soon.
Thanks guys!!!!
author: Mike W.

description: Service was polite and friendly. But the food was very disappointing. The bread was hard. The Caesar salad was fast food quality, in both taste and presentation. Expected more for $9. Our pasta entrees lacked flavor, but the pasta was cooked well. Outstanding location, but not great dining.
author: Ed S.

description: I purchased the Groupon so I decided to go right after church. We were not greeted at the door. Just told to sit anywhere which happens to be a wobbly table. The server took forever to come take our order. We had two burnt pizzas, olives were wilted. They forgot to give us any water. My ravioli was really cold and dry. They gave us like 8 ravoilis and a plate full of cream sauce. And they also forgot our side salad. The food was terrible and the service was really poor.
author: Jenny W.

description: I don't understand why this place doesn't have more stars! Filippo was amazing, the service was pretty quick. The pasta was really tasty and the bread was so bomb we asked for seconds. Somehow we found room for dessert and Lordy was the cassetta delicious.
author: Melissa M.

description: Mediocre is the best word I can use to describe this restaurant.  Life is too short for bland Italian food.
author: Dirk N.

description:
The staff was extremely friendly and welcoming, and the atmosphere is very "real"... looks and feels like a real Italian restaurant, and hearing the staff actually converse in Italian is a good sign, so after eyeing a few in the area, we decided on this place. It was a good choice. 

My wife and I both ordered veal dishes; her the veal parmesan and I the saltimbocca. The veal had the proper texture, and both dishes were delicious. The ingredients seemed pretty fresh.  The meal was preceded by bruschetta (very good ) and olives. They were out of the house Chianti we ordered, so they upgraded us to a nicer bottle at no charge. They also brought some yummy biscotti and gummy bears for after the meal.   Definitely recommend. We'll be back the next time we are in town.
author: Jared P.

description:
2/26/11 waitress/Kelsey was Wonderful! I always ask if the chef can make me putanesca if it's not on the menu & Salvatore/owner chef didn't let me down! Yummmmm. My friend knew him & he sat with us a few times during dinner, then more wine showed up, then the famous tiramisu, gummy bears & almond cookies! OMG, overload, the salavtore peeks around the corner "Grappa?" ...uh, ok! I'm so glad I wasn't to DD! Everything was excellent & we will be back furrrr surrre! I miss SF since moving to Sac (but love coming back for visits)
Give Michelangelo's a try, u can make reservations w/open table & get "yelpers" specials if ask.
author: Denise S.

description:
This is my 2nd time here and both times I have been happy with my food.  I had the Ravioli stuffed with lobster, my daughter had the cheese pizza and the Mr. had pollo di milanese.  I honestly would have given it this place 5 stars, but the service threw me off. 
We saw our server 3 times, once to place our orders, to deliver our food and to give us our check.  The bus boys are the ones who filled our glasses... Thank You.  There was one server who seemed to be helping all our tables around us and treated all of them like regulars and acted as if our table was just in the way.  We are not rude people and always say please and thank you.  Not sure what it was, but I had to minus to stars.
author: Jan-marie V.

description:
Door man lured us in when vacationing by saying if we didn't like it, dinner was on him ...

... Then introduced us to owner, who took our order, then forgot to write it down or correctly tell kitchen.  Owner then sat down with other customers and drank wine.

... When food finally came 40 minutes later, forgot my food.  What food we got was very subpar and bland.  Owner never got up from table next to us (couldn't put his wine glass down) to check on us.  Busboy finally flagged down and told that they forgot my food.  Owner offered no apology, no nothing ...

... chef went out front to smoke joint with people in car parking in front of restaurant. (Visible to my two kids from our window seat, not to mention the smell) ...

... Doorman was nowhere to be found when check came.

Busboy finally said sorry about the service ...

Crappy service and a we don't care (you're a tourist) attitude, not to mention bland (canned sause ?) food!!! 

AVOID !!!
author: Frank M.

description:
This place is a tourist trap with mediocre-tasting expensive food and un-attentive service.  Avoid at all costs.

We were hungry and had been walking around the city all day on the 4th of July.  We were lured in to Michelangelo's around dinnertime by a woman standing on the street advertising the fact that they were giving free bruschetta appetizers.  Didn't get a chance to check yelp first, and boy was that a mistake.

The promised bruschetta appetizer (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/michelangelo-ristorante-and-caffe-san-francisco-2?select=OW1BCGgFa722YcFD8NuNyQ#OW1BCGgFa722YcFD8NuNyQ) was very average and the tomatoes didn't taste fresh at all.  A man who appeared to be the restaurant manager/owner was basically making it in the hallway in front of a big tub of tomatoes.  Besides the average bruschetta, the bread they served also seemed quite stale.

My main dish - Fettuccine Mari E Monte - mushrooms, peas, scallops, and shrimp sauteed in tomato cream sauce - (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/michelangelo-ristorante-and-caffe-san-francisco-2?select=OW1BCGgFa722YcFD8NuNyQ#SO71UyUhR0shEncAnkdoig) was surprisingly decent.  Would rate it 3 stars as it had a good amount of scallops (albeit cut up) and shrimp that were flavorful.  Pricey for $17, but not horrible.

My boyfriend's dish was what really brought this place down to 1 star.  He ordered the filet mignon special (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/michelangelo-ristorante-and-caffe-san-francisco-2?select=OW1BCGgFa722YcFD8NuNyQ#eG5hqq-7WvdJs6IoR29K7A).  From the picture, you can see that it basically turned out as a large plate of overcooked beef that was  completely flavorless and basically piled onto the plate.  The restaurant clearly had no idea how to cook filet mignon.  The "special" seemed like a bunch of beef that they were just trying to dispose of.  On top of that, we even found a bristle from the grill brush stuck onto the meat.  Talk about poor quality control and potential for food borne illnesses.  The restaurant charged $29 for this "special".

The service was polite but relatively detached.  The waiter did not ask us how our food was at all during the meal.  It didn't seem like they were interested in retaining customers with their food quality.  We skipped the complimentary vanilla wafers and gummy bear candies for dessert (talk about being cheap) and will not be back.
author: Yun W.

description: This place is so annoyingly bad.  The service absolutely sucks and the food could not be more unimpressive.  Even the salads were horrible.  The only reason we went in is because the waits at all the good restaurants were too long. Of course this inadequate place had plenty of room.  The only good thing about the whole meal was the complimentary cookies.  I will never return to this restaurant.  Don't waste your money here.  Two thumbs down.
author: Elaine M.

description:
My family and I made reservations to celebrate my sisters birthday.  When we arrived they had our table ready. The service was great from the beginning to end and they were very friendly. We had a really great time there. Thank you for a great service and making it welcoming. We will be definitely coming back soon :) 
Definitely recommend this place!! Wish I could give them more than 5 stars they deserve alot more :)
author: Silvia R.

description:
My boyfriend and I walked into North Beach to find a new place for dinner. We started to look at the menu and one of the young waiters said that its a family restaurant and his dad makes all the pasta and sauces. We were sold so came in. 

The menu had two dishes perfect for our liking and before we ordered we were brought free delicious bruschetta! Our service was great and it felt very homie.

I ordered the pesto gnocchi which was creamy and delicious. My boyfriend was looking for meaty sauce and was not let down from the fettuccini bolognese. 

We devoured our meals and before we ordered dessert, they brought us free gummy bears and cookies. 

It was a perfect dinner!
author: Cristina R.

description: I cannot say more about the food and the service here. The lasagna was incredible but honestly the vibe  was just incredible. Happy hour is to die for. Can't say enough and we will go back
author: Holly B.

description: Amazing service and great food to match!! If you are in the area give them a try you won't be disappointed.
author: Michael G.

description: Love this place and come here every time we are in SF. Just a charming little Italian restaurant.
author: Andy M.

description:
I was walking through North Beach with my roommate looking for a nice Italian restaurant to eat dinner at. While walking past Michelangelo, a nice guy at the door convinced us to try the place, saying the Tiramisu and the pasta sauces are all homemade, so we decided to give it a go. 

The servers were all extremely friendly, and gave us bruschetta on the house that was pretty tasty. Then we decided to order the pizza appetizer and spaghetti/meatballs entree to share. The pizza was pretty tasty, and you can choose whatever toppings you want (salami, ham, cheese, mushroom, just ask them what topping there are) and it comes in thin crust! Our spaghetti was decent, but was more expensive than it actually tasted. 

For dessert they gave us a plate of gummy bears and almond cookies that are still sitting in my kitchen today. Overall this place has a nice vibe, but the food is definitely overpriced for the quality you get.
author: Jeanette S.

description: Service Sucked and so did the food. They didn't offer us bread like everyone  else. One waiter, bossy hostess. Bad combination
author: olivia a.

description: We stumbled upon this restaurant after attempting one near by busy restaurant that had no room for us and a second where the host walked away and never came back and started serving other guests and even sat a couple that recently walked up. Lucky for us! The service was awesome and had a great family feel. The staff went above and beyond and even brought  gummie bears for the kids at the end of the meal.Food was fresh and homemade.
author: April A.

description:
A fair Italian restaurant... just BE CAREFUL of their accounting tricks.
My bill was 2x of what it should have been, the math just didn't add up.
Charging me $120 for itemized list detailing $70.
Had to go back to the waiter to redo this 3 times.

The pasta is good, chippino was a microwaved or reheated batch.
The crostini for the chippino was cold stale and hard as a rock.
Shrimp and seafood was good but clearly frozen quality... you foodies know how to tell the difference right?

This is a tourist trap overcharging and ripping off unsuspecting tourist with cheap quality and charming waitors that are smooth with talk.
author: David H.

description: We bring our friends here from out of town so they can experience North Beach. Great Food and service. Try the Cioppino.
author: Constance C.

description:
We where hailed in with allure of gummy bears and cookies to my daughter. She loved her spaghetti, (with butter and cheese only) and she did say that it was very very good one notch below amazing.
My lasagna was good , not the best I have ever had, but it was baked wonderfully so I eat the crispy edge no problem. 
The service felt very rushed. Just not sure it because they where trying to just do a good job or get me out.
But when I got the bill I was amazed at the cost or lack of, so if price(expense) is a thought -this is a great place to stop.
author: Mark B.

description: The owners son was lovely. Convinced my hubby to dine there after he complimented the Raiders and offered a free appetiser. We ended up loving the food. Pasta was fresh. House Cab Sav was lovely! Hospitality was awesome! Hubby loves the food!
author: Prayna P.

description: Delicious!!  The spinach was to die for as was the chicken with sausage and mushrooms. A chicken breast pounded thin and sautéed with thinly sliced sweet Italian sausage and an abundance of wild mushrooms on a rosemary Marsala sauce.
author: Linda G.

description: Excellent service! Pretty much every employee came over to acknowledge us and check in with us throughout the meal. Bread was provided as well as olives and the most amazing bruschetta. I sipped on $5 Proseco and dined on capellini pomodoro which could have had more flavor but I still enjoyed it. The portions are great. My only complaint which has nothing to do with service or food is that it was so HOT! I was literally sweating as I ate. Obviously that's a quick fix!
author: Rebecca P.

description:
"I want stereotypical Italian-American food. I want pasta in a bowl served to me, by a guy who looks and sounds like Mario, on white and red checkered sheets. I want a candle in an empty Chianti bottle." Trying my best to please my boy, I got us a Groupon for "date night" at Michelangelo.

The tablecloths are white; there was no candle, and he was otherwise completely pleased.

The woman out front trying to convince passers-by to come in was so pleased that we entered I didn't have the heart to tell her we had a reservation. Still, as the night went by she filled the place up, presumably with tourists. 

We were met at the table with garlic bread, still warm, two pieces of bruschetta that was tasty enough, and a bowl of spiced olives that I didn't eat because olives, eww, too salty. My boy ate them absently throughout the meal and told me they were fine.

The highlight of the meal was the clams and mussels. Not that they were particularly fantastic, but they were pleasantly unadorned and nice. Simple sauce, nice flavor, and a clean finish.

For dinner, my boy talked me into the spaghetti with clam sauce, which he told me is often quite nice. It was bland. After a bite, his face fell in an avalanche of disappointment and he muttered that it's not supposed to be. His pappardelle was nice, but misspelled on the menu as "pappargelle".

Dessert was "home-made" tiramisu. It might have been home-made, but not that day--ours was frozen in the middle.

It's exactly what you'd expect from a trope Italian eatery in the heart of San Fran's own Little Italy. Three stars of Italian food.
author: Liuyin S.

description: Despite it's convenient location this place completely sucks. it is a tourist trap that has soulless food and cheesy doorman who try to get you to come inside with the allure of free gummy worms. The location is sadly proof they'll never change as it is conveniently across from Washington Square Park. Terrible food!
author: Navid B.

description: Went on a nice Saturday afternoon because we couldn't find any other available places for 4.  A smaller restaurant but has good seating.  The walls are covered in stone Art (some might be considered inappropriate) and mosaic tiled chandeliers.  Service was fine, they didn't really try to make conversation or tell us their name.  I had standard fettuccini with tomato and meat sauce and it was average, nothing outstanding for an Italian restaurant.  The gummy bears and cookies were random but a nice touch if u feel like staying and chatting.
author: Alison C.

description: WONDERFUL place!! The food, service and decor. The "on the house" tiramisu was the best we ever had, and was prepared by the owner himself, who spiced the experience his warm, friendly presence and authentic experience. One dines surrounded by a plethora of exquisite Roman art, from walls, to ceiling, to table. Efficient and helpful service. All of this for modest prices, less than nearby restaurants.  Highly recommended.
author: Arianna B.

description:
Is it me or did this place totally change over 20 years? Granted...it could be my taste is more sophisticated and a bowl of pasta with too much creamed pesto sauce may have appealed to me years ago...but certainly not now. It was way too rich and greasy. I barely ate it and didn't even want to bring it home.

They also have a wide screen TV installed. There is no bar. Why would an authentic Italian restaurant with only one room and no bar do this? Ummm...because they're appealing to a very different crowd than I run with.
author: Leslie K.

description: If I could give less then 1 star then I would! This is the worst restaurant ever. The waiter gave my food to another table and the person touched it. Then the waiter took it from him and proceeded to try to give it to me. When I didn't take it he took it to the kitchen and then 1 minute later tried to give me back the same plate and I refuse it again. I guess they made a new plate after about 5 minutes he brought me what I ordered, but as I took a bite there were egg shells in it. Left the place and found some where else to have dinner.
author: Katie Y.

description: Food got funny taste to it kind of like soap. My gf order the chicken parmigiana. She did not like it at all. I taste my gf chicken parmigiana it had a funny taste to it. I Would not eat it.
author: Dennis T.

description:
Friendly attentive service, fun decor and good pasta.

Dropped in for lunch with my daughter.  We both ordered pasta and both dishes were good.  It was a nice meal enjoyed with a glass of wine, bread and olives.  I didn't expect the ammereti and gummy bears so it was a pleasant fun surprise.  We enjoyed our meal and will return soon to try their other dishes.
author: Donna P.

description: My favorite Italian restaurant in north beach. I love the atmosphere, the setting, the music, and the service. The restaurant is facing sts. Peter and Paul, one of best looking churches in San Francisco. The place has tourists always walking in and by while you eat. I really enjoy people watching while eating at this restaurant. Anyways, I like to get calamari or carpaccio for an appetizer. This place also serves the typical bread with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. But what makes this place different is the olives and bruschetta that they give you on the house. All the entrees in this place are delicious. Which leaves me extremely full but I also get the dessert. My favorite dessert while dining here is the tiramisu. It's extremely moist and flavorful. You also get cookies and gummy bears for dessert.
author: Jason L.

description:
If you are thinking of buying the Groupon for this place=DON'T. The guy at the door hustles you in (of course) tells you that it's the best food in North Beach. So my girlfriend and I are starting to eat our (not the best) bread, with the olive oil and balsamic supplied at the table. After eating a few pieces I happened to focus on the bottle of oil and noticed something on the bottom. It was large chunks of mold! When I showed this one waitress she just kind of shrugged it off and removed bottle. The other table next to us appeared to have the same issue, had a hard time not pointing it out to the people eating the bread.

This pretty much ruined our dinner, which by the way was unremarkable. My main complaint with my dish is the flank steak was so tough it was hard to eat. I'm starting to think that all of the restaurants on Groupon are sub standard. A lot of the other places on Columbus are so busy there is a wait out front. Not this place, I guess they don't expect repeat business, they just hope to hustle the occasional tourist. At least take time to change out olive oil bottles, gross. I feel sick to my stomach as I write this. Don't trust North Beach restaurants on Groupon. Go to Sodinis, they don't need a Groupon because they are good!
author: Chris W.

description: Cafe Michelangelo's in North Beach (Little Italy) of SF. Fabulous Eggplant Parmagiano! OUT OF THIS WORLD, best I've had in years in SF.  Thinly sliced, lightly layered and nice thick and extremely fresh slice of mozzarella cheese.  Great service!
author: Gregg J.

description:
I ate here last night, and am returning again today. The food is fantastic and the staff were more than friendly. Situated just across from a park, the locations perfect and the decor is beautiful. 

Don't be fooled by the (currently) 3-star rating -- this place is well worth your time.
Nothing was too expensive and it came out fast. So, if you're in the area and are looking for some great Italian food, this is the place for you.
author: Ethan M.

description: We are staying in SF for a month and have had a wonderful time trying different restaurants. We stumbled upon this gem and we are so glad we did. Not only is the food phenomenal, but the service is extraordinary. This is definitely a family business of the best kind. The owner, Salvatore, was so welcoming and his son Stefano as our waiter was very attentive and kind. If you're looking for a quaint cafe with excellent food and service then this is the perfect spot. We will be back for sure!
author: Sharlene S.

description: My friend and I were walking around north beach, looking at different menu. It was getting late so we decided to go inside, the hosted had said their food was the best homemade pasta you have ever eaten, the prices were good, so we went inside. Worst mistake in my life! The foods had no taste at all.  A Box of pasta from Safeway would be better than this. Then for desert we got a plate of hard gummy bears and some old cookie that they probably had since last year.
author: Linda J.

description:
DELISH!!!  I'm gluten free, so I usually have a hard time getting good Italian food.  This place was GREAT!  Whenever I see risotto on a menu, I MUST HAVE!  Saffron Prawn Risotto.  Great.  Also ordered on our table was cioppino and gnocchi.  They gave us bruschetta first with delicious bread.  After dinner they gave us gummie bears and Italian cookies.  Everyone was family and super nice.  We are Italian ourselves and this place did not disappoint.

The decor is great.
author: R R.

description: The Lasagna was very good. At first I thought the portion just wasn't going to be enough but I was wrong. And the service was excellent!
author: Faith J.

description:
Bless this family's sweet heart. 
Enticed by the free wine we came in to eat. Enjoyed our food, wasn't particularly impressed, however the service was so great; friendly, fast, and generous. Definitely a family friendly spot.
author: Kevin J.

description:
As an Italian who grew up eating Nonna's cooking for 25 years, I am very picky when it comes to Italian cuisine. My friend and I headed to North Beach on Sunday and studied most of the restaurants along Columbus Ave before deciding on Michelangelo.

Atmosphere: The decor here is simple yet adorable and it was all decked out for the World Cup with every country's flag and of course a huge version of the Italian flag. The staff all spoke Italian as did the customers in the restaurant at the time. Very authentic vibe. 

Food: This place is the best Italian food I've had since moving to the Bay Area! It tasted very fresh and it was ready in no time. When we first sat down we received a nice bowl of complimentary olives and bread. We also received a free order of bruschetta for no reason at all!  When it came time for the bill we were brought gummi bears and yummy traditional almond cookies too. Who doesn't love free food?

Beverages: The house red was phenomenal. My latte was top notch too. 

Price: Pricing here was incredibly fair and lower than the average compared to the other restaurants on Colombus

I highly recommend Michelango & will definitely be coming back again soon! That's Amore
author: Cara S.

description:
Came in with a groupon and we were not impressed.  The veal saltimbocca was small and had a funny flavor and the Veal Marsala tasted off too.  Expected more since we are in North Beach.  The service was good and they were good to our kids and split their gnocchi.  The creme brûlée was great and highlight of the meal.

Unfortunately due to the food, we won't be coming back
author: Keith L.

description: Great food and they gave us a free appetizer and haribo gummibears for dessert. Would definitely visit again.
author: Paul M.

description: Bad food, bad service. The operate in "tourist" mode, and dish out slop. Better options up the street.
author: Stanley D.

description:
Hey, I won't deny it. The place is a bit kitschy.  The hodgepodge of statutes and replicas of other famous Italian artifacts make this place look like it's trying too hard. But then, you walk in and you are pleasantly surprised that they aren't trying to hit you over the head with Italy, it's all over the top with humor, love of the homeland and unabashed pride. So who cares if it's a little kitschy. They're not trying to be the new next thing or anything that they are not.  And when you take a bite of their homemade tiramisu all is quickly forgiven.

It's a laid back, warm and friendly place to walk in, grab a nice cup of cappuccino and nibble on a tasty selection of Italian desserts.  It speaks to the friendliness of the owners and staff when you receive a small plate of gummy bears to go with your coffee.  It's cute. It's friendly. And it's warm.  I'm a fan.
author: Syddie P.

description:
What a great idea, offer free glass of wine  by the hostess that is standing out front telling us to come inside and grab a bite to eat.  The server brought a glass of wine and some bruschetta. I really enjoyed the complimentary appetizers.

I ordered the fettuccine with bolognese sauce. I could not believe how good the sauce was. By far the best that I have had in a long time.

And the Bonus.... Gummy Bears with the ticket!!! I will be back before I head home...
author: Jason M.

description: Great lasagna, great service, it's like you're in Italy! And that's the bottom line, even though yelp is trying to make me write more! One star for yelp. :(
author: Jeff Z.

description: Buonissimo! Insalatta di pesce e spaghetti a la Bolognese! The decor has the feel of Roma. Large marble copies of Roman sculptures.
author: Joe C.

description:
Great food!  Great service!  Definitely a winner!  I practically received a standing ovation from my family for my decision to go here. 

We ordered  2 Spaghetti Alla Scaglie.   It came with large and extra crispy fresh shrimp, clams, and mussels.  Loved how the server brought out the big bowl of parmesan and heaped it on our plates.  The Fettuccine Mari E Monti - very nice seafood mix and tomato cream sauce.   I also ordered the Gnocchi Di Patate - so fluffy I bet they cut the pasta fresh to order.  The pizza was fantastic too!  Nice portions - nobody went home hungry.  

Loved the complimentary gummy bears and cookies.  Staff gave us plenty of attention - filled our water without asking and gave us anything we asked quickly.  

We will be back.
author: Andrew L.

description:
The son and father duo are such a great team! We came in for a little wine and a little food after a day of walking around. The son pulled us in with his charm and his father kept us with his impeccable service! Loved the food and the wine. 
It was also my boyfriends birthday and the father did a happy birthday in Italian solo! :) made our night :) keep up the charm guys!
author: Audie S.

description:
My wife and I had a delightful sidewalk dining experience, and Salvatore was an excellent host. The food was excellent, with truly fresh pasta, and the sauces were prepared with appropriate flavorings, and the aged parmaesan cheese for our salad and entrees was a crowning touch.

We are going back there again soon and bringing family and friends.
The Thomases
author: Don T.

description: Giving this establishment 2 stars is being generous. We were greeted outside by the owners son -Stefano and offered a free appetizer of our choice. We are seated promptly and had a very attentive waiter. The appetizer turned out to be bruschetta. It was average. However, not the appetizer of our choice.  I selected eggplant parmigiana as my entree and promised it was homemade and fresh. The dish arrived warm, not hot. The sauce was average but had a canned flavor - far from homemade. Watery, tasteless. We ordered a Pinot Noir, and the bottle was substituted with something of lesser quality. I offered the waiter a glass of wine and he declined. However, Stefano walks up to my table with an empty glass looking for a free handout of my wine - I have never experienced that ever before. It usually works in reverse, the owner patronizes the customer. Sad. I think in the beginning this establishment was a probably a great place to eat. Since the son has been operating the restaurant, it leaves something to be desired.  I should have reconsidered and waited the 1.5 hrs to have pizza at Tony's!
author: Virginia D.

description: Everything was so good and delicious!! Good and fast service!! I just think the dishes presentation was so simple. I like the place and I'll be back of course
author: Gabriel R.

description:
